required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Controlled Study of Humira in Subjects With Chronic Plaque Psoriasis of the Hands and/or Feet
clinical_study.official_title: Controlled Study of Humira in Subjects With Chronic Plaque Psoriasis of the Hands and/or Feet

brief_summary.textblock: Evaluate the efficacy and safety of a 16-week course of Humira (adalimumab) compared to placebo in adults with chronic plaque psoriasis of the hands and/or feet and the sustainability of response for 12 additional weeks.

primary_outcome.measure: Number of Subjects With Physician's Global Assessment of Psoriasis (PGA) of Clear or Almost Clear at Week 16
primary_outcome.description: Number of subjects achieving a PGA of clear (representing no signs of plaque psoriasis) or almost clear (representing just perceptible erythema and scaling) at Week 16. The PGA is a 5-point scale used to measure the severity of disease at the time of the physician's evaluation of the subject. The degree of overall severity is rated as follows: 0-Clear, 1-Almost clear, 2-Mild, 3-Moderate, and 4-Severe.

secondary_outcome.measure: Mean Change From Baseline in Erythema, Scaling, Induration, and Fissuring (ESIF)
secondary_outcome.description: Severity of each sign of ESIF was assessed using a 4-point scale (0 = clear, 1 = mild, 2 = moderate, and 3 = severe). The ESIF was calculated by adding the scores for the 4 signs for the two soles and two palms, for a total range from 0 (no disease) to 48 points (most severe condition). A decrease from Baseline in ESIF indicates improvement.

secondary_outcome.measure: Mean Change From Baseline in ESIF for Palms
secondary_outcome.description: Severity of each sign of ESIF was assessed using a 4-point scale (0 = clear, 1 = mild, 2 = moderate, and 3 = severe). The ESIF was calculated by adding the scores for the 4 signs for the palms of the hands, yielding a total range from 0 (no disease) to 24 points (most severe condition) for the palms. A decrease from Baseline in ESIF indicates improvement.

secondary_outcome.measure: Mean Change From Baseline in ESIF for Soles
secondary_outcome.description: Severity of each sign of ESIF was assessed using a 4-point scale (0 = clear, 1 = mild, 2 = moderate, and 3 = severe). The ESIF was calculated by adding the scores for the 4 signs for the soles of the feet, yielding a total range from 0 (no disease) to 24 points (most severe condition) for the soles. A decrease from Baseline in ESIF indicates improvement.

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Subjects With Moderate Improvement in ESIF From Baseline
secondary_outcome.description: Number of subjects that achieved > 50% reduction from Baseline in ESIF.

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Subjects With Marked Improvement in ESIF From Baseline
secondary_outcome.description: Number of subjects that achieved > 75% reduction from Baseline in ESIF

secondary_outcome.measure: Mean Change From Baseline in Nail Psoriasis Severity Index (NAPSI)
secondary_outcome.description: For subjects with psoriasis nail involvement at Baseline, the target fingernail (most severely involved fingernail at Baseline) was assessed for NAPSI throughout the study. NAPSI ranges from 0 (no nail psoriasis) to 8 (most severe nail psoriasis).

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Subjects With Physicians Global Assessment of Psoriasis (PGA) of Clear, Almost Clear, or Mild
secondary_outcome.description: Number of subjects achieving a PGA of clear (representing no signs of plaque psoriasis), almost clear (representing just perceptible erythema and scaling), or mild (representing light pink erythema with minimal scaling and with or without pustules). The PGA is a 5-point scale used to measure the severity of disease at the time of the physician's evaluation of the subject. The degree of overall severity is rated as follows: 0-Clear, 1-Almost clear, 2-Mild, 3-Moderate, and 4-Severe.

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Subjects With PGA of Clear or Almost Clear
secondary_outcome.description: Number of subjects achieving a PGA of clear (representing no signs of plaque psoriasis) or almost clear (representing just perceptible erythema and scaling). The PGA is a 5-point scale used to measure the severity of disease at the time of the physician's evaluation of the subject. The degree of overall severity is rated as follows: 0-Clear, 1-Almost clear, 2-Mild, 3-Moderate, and 4-Severe.

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Subjects With PGA of Clear
secondary_outcome.description: Number of subjects achieving a PGA of clear (representing no signs of plaque psoriasis). The PGA is a 5-point scale used to measure the severity of disease at the time of the physician's evaluation of the subject. The degree of overall severity is rated as follows: 0-Clear, 1-Almost clear, 2-Mild, 3-Moderate, and 4-Severe.

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Subjects With Psoriasis Area and Severity Index (PASI) 50
secondary_outcome.description: Number of subjects who achieved 50% or greater improvement from baseline PASI. The PASI scale is from 0 (no psoriasis) to 72 (complete erythroderma of the severest possible degree).
Number of subjects who achieved 75% or greater improvement from baseline PASI. The PASI scale is from 0 (no psoriasis) to 72 (complete erythroderma of the severest possible degree).
Number of subjects who achieved 90% or greater improvement from baseline PASI. The PASI scale is from 0 (no psoriasis) to 72 (complete erythroderma of the severest possible degree).
Number of subjects who achieved 100% improvement from baseline PASI. The PASI scale is from 0 (no psoriasis) to 72 (complete erythroderma of the severest possible degree).

secondary_outcome.measure: Mean Change From Baseline in Dermatology Life Quality Index (DLQI)
secondary_outcome.description: The DLQI consists of 10 questions and is scored from 0 (total lack of impairment) to 30 (life is very much impaired). A decrease in DLQI indicates improvement.

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Subjects Achieving a DLQI of 0
secondary_outcome.description: Number of subjects achieving a DLQI score of 0, indicating total lack of impairment. The DLQI consists of 10 questions and is scored from 0 to 30 (life is very much impaired). A decrease in DLQI indicates improvement.

secondary_outcome.measure: Mean Change From Baseline in Visual Analog Scale (VAS) for Psoriasis and Psoriatic Arthritis Pain
secondary_outcome.description: On one single VAS, subjects assessed their pain due to psoriasis (and psoriatic arthritis, if applicable). Mean change in psoriasis and psoriatic arthritis pain from Baseline as measured by a VAS from 0 (no pain) to 100 (pain as bad as it could be).

secondary_outcome.measure: Mean Change From Baseline in Work Productivity and Activity Impairment Questionnaire: Psoriasis (WPAI:PSO)
secondary_outcome.description: WPAI:PSO assesses the effect on the subject's ability to work and perform regular activities in 4 areas: % work time (in hours) missed due to psoriasis, % impairment while working (on a scale from 0 [psoriasis having no effect] to 10 [psoriasis completely prevented subject from working]), % overall work impairment (on a scale from 0 [psoriasis having no effect] to 10 [psoriasis completely prevented subject from working]), and % activity impairment (on a scale from 0 [psoriasis having no effect on daily activities] to 10 [psoriasis completely prevented subject from doing daily activities]).

secondary_outcome.measure: Mean Change From Baseline in Patient Health Questionnaire (PHQ-9)
secondary_outcome.description: The PHQ-9 consists of 9 questions that assess how often over the past 2 weeks subjects had signs or symptoms of depression (0=not at all, 1=several days, 2=more than half days, and 3=nearly every day). The PHQ-9 is the sum of the scores from the 9 questions for a total range from 0 (not depressed at all) to 27 (depressed nearly every day).

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Subjects With Difficulties According to PHQ-9
secondary_outcome.description: Based on the 9 questions of the PHQ-9, if subjects indicated any problems (PHQ-9 score > 0), the difficulty to do work, take care of things at home, and get along with people (question 10 of the PHQ) were assessed (not difficult at all, somewhat difficult, very difficult, and extremely difficult).

arm_group.description: Loading dose of 2 placebo injections at Week 0 and placebo injections every other week (eow) from Week 1 through Week 15. In second period of study, subjects who continued in the study received 80 mg adalimumab at Week 16 followed by open-label 40 mg adalimumab eow from Week 17 to Week 27.

80 mg adalimumab loading dose at Week 0 and 40 mg adalimumab eow from Weeks 1 through 15. For subjects who continued in the second period of the study, subjects received 2 placebo injections at Week 16 to maintain the blind. Open-label 40 mg adalimumab eow was administered from Week 17 through Week 27.

intervention.description: Loading dose of 2 placebo subcutaneous (SC) injections (0.8 ml) at Week 0 followed by 1 injection SC eow from Week 1 to Week 15.In second period of study, subjects who continued in the study received 80 mg adalimumab at Week 16 followed by open-label 40 mg adalimumab eow from Week 17 to Week 27.
Loading dose of 80 mg adalimumab SC (two 40 mg injections) followed by 40 mg adalimumab SC eow.

group.title: Placebo/Adalimumab
group.description: Placebo injections every other week (eow) up to Week 15. In second period of study, subjects who continued to participate received 80 mg adalimumab at Week 16 followed by open-label 40 mg adalimumab eow from Week 17 to Week 27.

group.title: Adalimumab
group.description: 80 mg adalimumab loading dose at Week 0 and 40 mg adalimumab eow from Weeks 1 through 27. Subjects received 2 placebo injections at Week 16 to maintain the blind.

participants_list.participants: Per visit window, 18 completed; 17 completed per subject case report form.

group.title: Placebo/Adalimumab
group.description: Placebo injections every other week (eow) up to Week 15. In second period of study, subjects who continued to participate received 80 mg adalimumab at Week 16 followed by open-label 40 mg adalimumab eow from Week 17 to Week 27.

group.title: Adalimumab
group.description: 80 mg adalimumab loading dose at Week 0 and 40 mg adalimumab eow from Weeks 1 through 27. Subjects received 2 placebo injections at Week 16 to maintain the blind.

group.title: Total
group.description: Total of all reporting groups

measure.title: Age
Age
Gender
Region of Enrollment

outcome.title: Number of Subjects With Physician's Global Assessment of Psoriasis (PGA) of Clear or Almost Clear at Week 16
outcome.description: Number of subjects achieving a PGA of clear (representing no signs of plaque psoriasis) or almost clear (representing just perceptible erythema and scaling) at Week 16. The PGA is a 5-point scale used to measure the severity of disease at the time of the physician's evaluation of the subject. The degree of overall severity is rated as follows: 0-Clear, 1-Almost clear, 2-Mild, 3-Moderate, and 4-Severe.
outcome.population: Analysis was based on the intention to treat (ITT) subject population. Subjects who did not achieve PGA assessments at Week 16 were imputed as non-responders.

group.title: Placebo/Adalimumab
group.description: Placebo injections every other week (eow) up to Week 15. In second period of study, subjects who continued to participate received 80 mg adalimumab at Week 16 followed by open-label 40 mg adalimumab eow from Week 17 to Week 27.

group.title: Adalimumab
group.description: 80 mg adalimumab loading dose at Week 0 and 40 mg adalimumab eow from Weeks 1 through 27. Subjects received 2 placebo injections at Week 16 to maintain the blind.

measure.title: Number of Subjects With Physician's Global Assessment of Psoriasis (PGA) of Clear or Almost Clear at Week 16
measure.description: Number of subjects achieving a PGA of clear (representing no signs of plaque psoriasis) or almost clear (representing just perceptible erythema and scaling) at Week 16. The PGA is a 5-point scale used to measure the severity of disease at the time of the physician's evaluation of the subject. The degree of overall severity is rated as follows: 0-Clear, 1-Almost clear, 2-Mild, 3-Moderate, and 4-Severe.
measure.population: Analysis was based on the intention to treat (ITT) subject population. Subjects who did not achieve PGA assessments at Week 16 were imputed as non-responders.

analysis.groups_desc: The primary null hypothesis for this study was that there was no difference in the proportion of subjects that achieved PGA clear or almost clear at Week 16 between the adalimumab and placebo groups. Analysis was done using a two-sided Fisher's exact test at alpha level=0.05.

outcome.title: Mean Change From Baseline in Erythema, Scaling, Induration, and Fissuring (ESIF)
outcome.description: Severity of each sign of ESIF was assessed using a 4-point scale (0 = clear, 1 = mild, 2 = moderate, and 3 = severe). The ESIF was calculated by adding the scores for the 4 signs for the two soles and two palms, for a total range from 0 (no disease) to 48 points (most severe condition). A decrease from Baseline in ESIF indicates improvement.
outcome.population: Analysis was based on the ITT subject population and performed using last observation carried forward (LOCF) method.

group.title: Placebo/Adalimumab
group.description: Placebo injections every other week (eow) up to Week 15. In second period of study, subjects who continued to participate received 80 mg adalimumab at Week 16 followed by open-label 40 mg adalimumab eow from Week 17 to Week 27.

group.description: 80 mg adalimumab loading dose at Week 0 and 40 mg adalimumab eow from Weeks 1 through 27. Subjects received 2 placebo injections at Week 16 to maintain the blind.

The ESIF was calculated by adding the scores for the 4 signs for the two soles and two palms, for a total range from 0 (no disease) to 48 points (most severe condition). A decrease from Baseline in ESIF indicates improvement.

outcome.title: Mean Change From Baseline in Nail Psoriasis Severity Index (NAPSI)
outcome.description: For subjects with psoriasis nail involvement at Baseline, the target fingernail (most severely involved fingernail at Baseline) was assessed for NAPSI throughout the study. NAPSI ranges from 0 (no nail psoriasis) to 8 (most severe nail psoriasis).
outcome.population: Analysis was performed in the ITT subject population for subjects with nail involvement at baseline only and is based on LOCF.

group.title: Placebo/Adalimumab
group.description: Placebo injections every other week (eow) up to Week 15. In second period of study, subjects who continued to participate received 80 mg adalimumab at Week 16 followed by open-label 40 mg adalimumab eow from Week 17 to Week 27.

group.title: Adalimumab
group.description: 80 mg adalimumab loading dose at Week 0 and 40 mg adalimumab eow from Weeks 1 through 27. Subjects received 2 placebo injections at Week 16 to maintain the blind.

measure.title: Mean Change From Baseline in Nail Psoriasis Severity Index (NAPSI)
measure.description: For subjects with psoriasis nail involvement at Baseline, the target fingernail (most severely involved fingernail at Baseline) was assessed for NAPSI throughout the study. NAPSI ranges from 0 (no nail psoriasis) to 8 (most severe nail psoriasis).
measure.population: Analysis was performed in the ITT subject population for subjects with nail involvement at baseline only and is based on LOCF.

outcome.description: Number of subjects achieving a PGA of clear (representing no signs of plaque psoriasis), almost clear (representing just perceptible erythema and scaling), or mild (representing light pink erythema with minimal scaling and with or without pustules). The PGA is a 5-point scale used to measure the severity of disease at the time of the physician's evaluation of the subject. The degree of overall severity is rated as follows: 0-Clear, 1-Almost clear, 2-Mild, 3-Moderate, and 4-Severe.
outcome.population: Analysis was based on the ITT subject population and performed using non-responder imputation (NRI).

measure.title: Mean Change From Baseline in Dermatology Life Quality Index (DLQI)
measure.description: The DLQI consists of 10 questions and is scored from 0 (total lack of impairment) to 30 (life is very much impaired). A decrease in DLQI indicates improvement.
measure.population: Analysis was based on the ITT subject population and performed using LOCF.

outcome.title: Number of Subjects Achieving a DLQI of 0
outcome.description: Number of subjects achieving a DLQI score of 0, indicating total lack of impairment. The DLQI consists of 10 questions and is scored from 0 to 30 (life is very much impaired). A decrease in DLQI indicates improvement.
outcome.population: Analysis was based on the ITT subject population and performed using NRI.

group.title: Placebo/Adalimumab
group.description: Placebo injections every other week (eow) up to Week 15. In second period of study, subjects who continued to participate received 80 mg adalimumab at Week 16 followed by open-label 40 mg adalimumab eow from Week 17 to Week 27.

group.title: Adalimumab
group.description: 80 mg adalimumab loading dose at Week 0 and 40 mg adalimumab eow from Weeks 1 through 27. Subjects received 2 placebo injections at Week 16 to maintain the blind.

measure.title: Number of Subjects Achieving a DLQI of 0
measure.description: Number of subjects achieving a DLQI score of 0, indicating total lack of impairment. The DLQI consists of 10 questions and is scored from 0 to 30 (life is very much impaired). A decrease in DLQI indicates improvement.
measure.population: Analysis was based on the ITT subject population and performed using NRI.

outcome.title: Mean Change From Baseline in Visual Analog Scale (VAS) for Psoriasis and Psoriatic Arthritis Pain
outcome.description: On one single VAS, subjects assessed their pain due to psoriasis (and psoriatic arthritis, if applicable). Mean change in psoriasis and psoriatic arthritis pain from Baseline as measured by a VAS from 0 (no pain) to 100 (pain as bad as it could be).
outcome.population: Analysis was based on the ITT subject population and performed using LOCF.

group.title: Placebo/Adalimumab
group.description: Placebo injections every other week (eow) up to Week 15. In second period of study, subjects who continued to participate received 80 mg adalimumab at Week 16 followed by open-label 40 mg adalimumab eow from Week 17 to Week 27.

group.title: Adalimumab
group.description: 80 mg adalimumab loading dose at Week 0 and 40 mg adalimumab eow from Weeks 1 through 27. Subjects received 2 placebo injections at Week 16 to maintain the blind.

measure.title: Mean Change From Baseline in Visual Analog Scale (VAS) for Psoriasis and Psoriatic Arthritis Pain
measure.description: On one single VAS, subjects assessed their pain due to psoriasis (and psoriatic arthritis, if applicable). Mean change in psoriasis and psoriatic arthritis pain from Baseline as measured by a VAS from 0 (no pain) to 100 (pain as bad as it could be).
measure.population: Analysis was based on the ITT subject population and performed using LOCF.

outcome.title: Mean Change From Baseline in Work Productivity and Activity Impairment Questionnaire: Psoriasis (WPAI:PSO)
outcome.description: WPAI:PSO assesses the effect on the subject's ability to work and perform regular activities in 4 areas: % work time (in hours) missed due to psoriasis, % impairment while working (on a scale from 0 [psoriasis having no effect] to 10 [psoriasis completely prevented subject from working]), % overall work impairment (on a scale from 0 [psoriasis having no effect] to 10 [psoriasis completely prevented subject from working]), and % activity impairment (on a scale from 0 [psoriasis having no effect on daily activities] to 10 [psoriasis completely prevented subject from doing daily activities]).
outcome.population: Analysis was based on the ITT subject population and performed using LOCF.

group.title: Placebo/Adalimumab
group.description: Placebo injections every other week (eow) up to Week 15. In second period of study, subjects who continued to participate received 80 mg adalimumab at Week 16 followed by open-label 40 mg adalimumab eow from Week 17 to Week 27.

group.title: Adalimumab
group.description: 80 mg adalimumab loading dose at Week 0 and 40 mg adalimumab eow from Weeks 1 through 27. Subjects received 2 placebo injections at Week 16 to maintain the blind.

measure.title: Mean Change From Baseline in Work Productivity and Activity Impairment Questionnaire: Psoriasis (WPAI:PSO)
measure.description: WPAI:PSO assesses the effect on the subject's ability to work and perform regular activities in 4 areas: % work time (in hours) missed due to psoriasis, % impairment while working (on a scale from 0 [psoriasis having no effect] to 10 [psoriasis completely prevented subject from working]), % overall work impairment (on a scale from 0 [psoriasis having no effect] to 10 [psoriasis completely prevented subject from working]), and % activity impairment (on a scale from 0 [psoriasis having no effect on daily activities] to 10 [psoriasis completely prevented subject from doing daily activities]).
measure.population: Analysis was based on the ITT subject population and performed using LOCF.

class.title: % Work Time Missed due to Psoriasis Week 8
% Work Time Missed due to Psoriasis Week 16
% Work Time Missed due to Psoriasis Week 28 (OL)

outcome.title: Mean Change From Baseline in Patient Health Questionnaire (PHQ-9)
outcome.description: The PHQ-9 consists of 9 questions that assess how often over the past 2 weeks subjects had signs or symptoms of depression (0=not at all, 1=several days, 2=more than half days, and 3=nearly every day). The PHQ-9 is the sum of the scores from the 9 questions for a total range from 0 (not depressed at all) to 27 (depressed nearly every day).
outcome.population: Analysis was based on the ITT subject population and performed using LOCF.

group.title: Placebo/Adalimumab
group.description: Placebo injections every other week (eow) up to Week 15. In second period of study, subjects who continued to participate received 80 mg adalimumab at Week 16 followed by open-label 40 mg adalimumab eow from Week 17 to Week 27.

group.title: Adalimumab
group.description: 80 mg adalimumab loading dose at Week 0 and 40 mg adalimumab eow from Weeks 1 through 27. Subjects received 2 placebo injections at Week 16 to maintain the blind.

measure.title: Mean Change From Baseline in Patient Health Questionnaire (PHQ-9)
measure.description: The PHQ-9 consists of 9 questions that assess how often over the past 2 weeks subjects had signs or symptoms of depression (0=not at all, 1=several days, 2=more than half days, and 3=nearly every day). The PHQ-9 is the sum of the scores from the 9 questions for a total range from 0 (not depressed at all) to 27 (depressed nearly every day).
measure.population: Analysis was based on the ITT subject population and performed using LOCF.

outcome.title: Number of Subjects With Difficulties According to PHQ-9
outcome.description: Based on the 9 questions of the PHQ-9, if subjects indicated any problems (PHQ-9 score > 0), the difficulty to do work, take care of things at home, and get along with people (question 10 of the PHQ) were assessed (not difficult at all, somewhat difficult, very difficult, and extremely difficult).
outcome.population: Analysis was based on the ITT subject population. Missing values were imputed as "extremely difficult."

group.title: Placebo/Adalimumab
group.description: Placebo injections every other week (eow) up to Week 15. In second period of study, subjects who continued to participate received 80 mg adalimumab at Week 16 followed by open-label 40 mg adalimumab eow from Week 17 to Week 27.

group.title: Adalimumab
group.description: 80 mg adalimumab loading dose at Week 0 and 40 mg adalimumab eow from Weeks 1 through 27. Subjects received 2 placebo injections at Week 16 to maintain the blind.

measure.title: Number of Subjects With Difficulties According to PHQ-9
measure.description: Based on the 9 questions of the PHQ-9, if subjects indicated any problems (PHQ-9 score > 0), the difficulty to do work, take care of things at home, and get along with people (question 10 of the PHQ) were assessed (not difficult at all, somewhat difficult, very difficult, and extremely difficult).
measure.population: Analysis was based on the ITT subject population. Missing values were imputed as "extremely difficult."

reported_events.time_frame: All adverse events (AEs) from the time of study drug administration until 70 days following completion (Week 28) or discontinuation of study drug administration.
reported_events.desc: For subjects who continued adalimumab therapy (commercial) after discontinuation of study treatment, AEs that occurred after the first dose of non-study provided adalimumab were not to be report in this study, but rather via the usual post-marketing reporting process.

group.title: Placebo/Adalimumab
group.description: Placebo injections every other week (eow) up to Week 15. In second period of study, subjects who continued to participate received 80 mg adalimumab at Week 16 followed by open-label 40 mg adalimumab eow from Week 17 to Week 27.

group.title: Adalimumab
group.description: 80 mg adalimumab loading dose at Week 0 and 40 mg adalimumab eow from Weeks 1 through 27. Subjects received 2 placebo injections at Week 16 to maintain the blind.

category.title: Neoplasms benign, malignant and unspecified (incl cysts and polyps)

certain_agreements.pi_employee: Principal Investigators are NOT employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: Abbott requests that any investigator or institution that plans on presenting/publishing results disclosure, provide written notification of their request 60 days prior to their presentation/publication. Abbott requests that no presentation/publication be instituted until 12 months after a study is completed, or after the first presentation/publication whichever occurs first. A delay may be proposed of a presentation/publication if Abbott needs to secure patent or proprietary protection.

clinical_results.limitations_and_caveats: Based on one investigator's non-compliance with the protocol at one site, ITT analyses were conducted in a smaller number of subjects that excluded all 9 subjects from this one site.
